title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.3: EDUCATION POLICY AND CARRICULA

description.narrative: Output 2.3: MoE has improved capacity to develop, review and implement gender-equitable education policy, including curriculum reform and strengthened information management, to improve learning outcomes and develop life skill for employment for girls and boys, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2 - Improved Early Learning and Education: An increased proportion of children aged 0 to 18, especially girls from most disadvantaged counties, informal settlements and those affected by humanitarian crisis, access quality, gender- sensitive Early Child Development (ECD) and education services, with increased transition to secondary education.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF EDUCATION STATE DEPARTM OF EARLY LEARNING AND BASIC EDUCATION NAROK COUNTY

related-activity.ref: 2400/A0/06/002 OUTCOME 2: IMPROVED EARLY LEARNING AND EDUCATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.3: MoE has improved capacity to develop, review and implement gender-equitable education policy, including curriculumreform and strengthened information management, to improve learning outcomes and develop life skill for employment for girls andboys

description.narrative: During this reporting period UNICEF continued with upstream engagements and advocacy on curriculum reforms, competence-based assessment with the government for provision of quality education to all children to improve learning outcomes and skills development. ;As a result of UNICEF Coordination;and; technical support, the Kenya Institute of Curriculum Development (KICD) developed guidelines on Community Service Learning (CSL) which will support the implementation of CSL as a learning area in the current Competence Based Curriculum (CBC) as well as the operationalization of the mentorship policy by Ministry of Education to build the competencies and skills for the 21st Century learners. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/12/2021
